lead_paragraph: SHAPIRO--Joanne Franklin, 92, of Tampa, Florida, formerly of Sarasota and Queens, New York, died peacefully and on her own terms on April 17, 2016. Mrs. Shapiro was born in 1923 in Jersey City, NJ, and graduated from the University of Pennsylvania and graduate program at Fordham School of Social Work. In 1946, she married Dr. Howard Elias Shapiro, who predeceased her. Dr. and Mrs. Shapiro settled and raised their children in Queens, New York, before retiring to Sarasota, Florida. Ms. Shapiro was an avid theater-goer, traveler, and reader of The New Yorker and the New York Times. She enjoyed spending time with her children, grandchildren, and great grandchildren. She is remembered by her daughter and son-in-law, Nancy and Richard Lewis of Tampa, Florida; son and partner, Robert Shapiro and Leonardo Acosta; grandchildren and their spouses Jessica Lewis and Mark Lazar; David Lewis and Lynn Pieper; Allison Shapiro; and Thomas and Katherine Shapiro; and three great-grandchildren Michael, Rachel and Olivia. There will be no memorial service. For those who wish to make a contribution in her memory, a donation to the New York theater scene, which she loved, can be made to the Broadway League Foundation (broadwayleague.com) or to the Public Theater (publictheater.org). 1/3
